page.title: 01Burrington NW Corner
page.content: Area overlaps into high Bickington, Roborough and Chittlehamholt parishes. The B3217 road runs north/south of the section. In the n/e of the section are the A377 Barnstaple/Exeter Road, the railway line and the River Taw (parish boundary). The land is mainly agricultural. Dairy/sheep farming and crops for animal feed. On Kingford Hill, High Bickington, is a country club with holiday chalets. A hotel, Northcote Manor, Burrington, has ten letting bedrooms with bathrooms.There is a station, the Portsmouth Arms, two trains a day will stop by request, the travellers must wave down the train from the platform and buy a ticket on train. Public transprot is not good. Apart from the train,there is a market bus from Burrington Village to Barnstaple on Tuesday and Fridays.
